result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Syverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J Syverson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC sent to Atty Eugene Detert has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to:  8585 W. Forest Home Ave Ste 100  Milwaukee, WI  53228

11:38 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Eugene Detert.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with a fine and costs and DNA sample and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Detert concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Detert.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

$200 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:44 a.m.

8:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Eugene Detert.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Detert confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Detert enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing in approx 30 days - October 13, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:54 a.m.
Notice of Hearing sent to Atty Eugene Detert has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to:  8585 W. Forest Home Ave Suite 100  Milwaukee, WI  53228

Atty Eugene Detert called and requested this matter be adjourned as he is not available on 08/25.  Matter adjourned to September 8, 2015 at 8:30 a.m  New notice will be sent out upon receipt of the Notice of Retainer.
43
